_header: Now loves comes with largess loud
Title(s): ‘The Petition of the Gray Horse, Auld Dunbar’
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The Petition of the Gray Horse, Auld Dunbar’ — eleven 6-line stanzas including 2-line refrain, ‘…Schir lat It neuer In toume be tald / That I suld be ane ȝowllis ȝald’, and a concluding ‘Responsio Regis’ in four couplets

CULLl510.First Lines:
Suppois I war ane ald ȝaid averSchott furth our clewch to Pull
                    þe clauer…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…ffor with my hand I haue indostTo pay quateuir his trappouris
                    cost

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
…Suppois I war ane ald ȝaid averschott furth our clewch
                    to squische the cleuer…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…My lyff hes bein so miserabellmy hyd to offer I am
                    abell…
CamMagPep2553.Note:
Lines 23-54 only, treated as complete work, with burden before; last two
                    lines too faded to read.
